data.Name: Marianne Gilmore
data.staff_bio:
Marianne Gilmore, M.S., CRC, is currently the program supervisor of ICI's employment programs. Along with program management and staff supervision, Marianne continues to provide direct services to individuals with disabilities. Working with ICI since 1989 has helped to make Marianne a leader in the field of vocational rehabilitation. She has over 17 years of rehabilitation experience, with expertise in job search and career advancement, diversity and disability, and assisting staff to provide high-quality services to people with disabilities. At ICI, she has assisted in the Working Connections project grant awarding process, worked as the intake and referral contact for employment programs, mentored participants in the job development certificate program, and participated in an employer focus group. Marianne has held an office on the board of directors at Outdoor Explorations, an inclusive recreation group, and is currently serving a three-year term on the national board of the Association for Persons in Supported Employment, a group that promotes persons in supported employment.

Marianne passionately believes that all people with disabilities should be given the support they need to be successful in their communities: professionally, personally, and socially. Marianne graduated from Boston University with a master's degree in rehabilitation counseling and is certified in rehabilitation counseling as well. She has provided training and technical assistance on topics such as assistive technology and employment-related services locally and nationally.
